text: Lieutenant general Ernst Ludwig von Tippelskirch (26 July 1774 in Gut Görken, Prussia – 23 January 1840 in Berlin) was a Prussian army officer during the Napoleonic wars. Late he was commandant of Berlin, and at the same time the commander of land warfare. He served as Fortress Commander (Festungskommandant) of Petersberg Citadel in Erfurt from 1825 to 1827.Moritz, Horst (2002). Die Festung Petersberg unter Preußen 1802–1918. title: Ernst Ludwig von Tippelskirch
